question.body: Postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system receive input from all of the following sources except

multiple_choice.choice: preganglionic neurons in the lateral horn of all levels of the spinal cord
preganglionic neurons that synapse in the sympathetic chain
preganglionic neurons that originate in the lumbar level of the spinal cord
preganglionic neurons that pass through the sympathetic chain without synapsing
all of the above are correct, no exceptions

response.feedback: Correct. Postganglionic neurons in the sympathetic nervous system do not receive input from preganglionic neurons at cervical and sacral levels of the spinal cord.
Incorrect. This statement is true for a source of input to postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system.
Incorrect. This statement is true for a source of input to postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system.
Incorrect. This statement is true for a source of input to postganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system.
Incorrect. There is only one exception among the answer options.

part.hint: Preganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system do not originate from cervical and sacral levels of the spinal cord.
Preganglionic neurons of the sympathetic nervous system project to two distinct sets of postganglionic neurons.
